solution_line_template: If Ariella has ${difference} more in her son's saving account than Daniella has, then she has ${daniella_amount} + ${difference} = ${ariella_amount}

If she earns an interest of 10% in the first year, her savings account increases by {interest_rate} * ${ariella_amount} = $<<{interest_rate}*{ariella_amount}={first_year_interest}>>{first_year_interest}
In the second year, she earns the same amount of interest, which ${first_year_interest} + ${second_year_interest} = $<<{first_year_interest}+{second_year_interest}={total_interest}>>{total_interest}
The total amount of money in Ariella's account after two years is ${ariella_amount} + ${total_interest} = $<<{ariella_amount}+{total_interest}={total_amount}>>{total_amount}
